name: Rarefied Lexicon
description: 30 exceptional words for the most dedicated wordsmith

words.definition: Composed of both good and evil.
The action of estimating something as worthless.
examples: His floccinaucinihilipilification of modern art was extreme.
The word itself is famous for its length.

words.definition: Fear of long words.
examples: The irony of hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia is intentional.
This word is often used humorously.

words.definition: A lung disease caused by inhaling very fine silica dust.
examples: This is one of the longest English words.

words.definition: Opposition to withdrawing state support from a church.
examples: The word is famous for its length.

words.definition: Relating to charity; charitable.
A state of human flourishing and well-being.
examples: Aristotle defined the good life as eudaimonia.

words.definition: Government by the worst or least qualified people.
examples: The kakistocracy led to national decline.

words.definition: Thinking of the perfect reply too late; staircase wit.
examples: She suffered from l'esprit de l'escalier constantly.
The perfect comeback came as l'esprit de l'escalier.

words.definition: A misheard word or phrase that creates a new meaning.
examples: 'Scuse me while I kiss this guy' is a famous mondegreen.

words.definition: The pleasure of anticipating success.
examples: The nikhedonia was almost better than winning.

words.definition: Contemplation of one's navel; self-absorbed introspection.
examples: Critics dismissed it as mere omphaloskepsis.

words.definition: The act of stretching and yawning.
examples: Morning pandiculation helps wake the body.
She completed her pandiculation before rising.

words.definition: Soundness of mind; prudence and self-control.
A petty lie; pretentious nonsense.
examples: His excuse was just a taradiddle.

words.definition: A person in tattered clothing; a ragamuffin.
examples: He looked like a tatterdemalion after the journey.

words.definition: A knockout blow, physically or figuratively.
Petty or trivial; quibbling over minor details.
examples: The pettifogging lawyer annoyed the judge.
Stop pettifogging and address the main issue.

words.definition: Depression after waking from a pleasant dream.
Tending to produce laughter.
examples: The comedian's gelogenic material was popular.

words.definition: Relating to illness caused by medical treatment.
Physical or intellectual pleasure, delight, or ecstasy.
Incorrect pronunciation.
examples: His cacoepy of foreign words was noticeable.

words.definition: An urge to do something inadvisable.
examples: He had a cacoethes for gambling.

words.definition: Relating to the underworld; subterranean.
Having the power to avert evil influences.
examples: Apotropaic symbols were carved above doors.

words.definition: To cloud over; obscure.
examples: His explanations obnubilated rather than clarified.

words.definition: Proceeding by inquiry or investigation.
examples: His zetetic approach questioned all assumptions.
Zetetic philosophy emphasizes doubt and inquiry.

words.definition: The act of traveling as a stranger.
examples: His xenization through Asia changed him.
She embraced xenization as a way of life.

words.definition: Concise or condensed expression; brevity of diction.
examples: Her brachylogy made the message clear.
